arabic_text: وَٱلذَّٰرِيَٰتِ ذَرۡوٗا
phonetic: 51.1 Wa Adh-Dhāriyāti Dharwan

translations.english_saheeh: By the [winds] scattering [dust], dispersing [it]
translations.english_hilali_khan: 1. By (the winds) that scatter dust.
translations.english_rwwad: By the winds that scatters [dust],

arabic_text: فَٱلۡحَٰمِلَٰتِ وِقۡرٗا
phonetic: 51.2 Fālĥāmilāti Wiqrāan

translations.english_saheeh: And the [clouds] carrying a load [of water]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And (the clouds) that bear heavy weight of water.
translations.english_rwwad: and by the heavily-laden clouds with water,

arabic_text: فَٱلۡجَٰرِيَٰتِ يُسۡرٗا
phonetic: 51.3 Fāljāriyāti Yusrāan

translations.english_saheeh: And the ships sailing with ease
translations.english_hilali_khan: And (the ships) that float with ease and gentleness.
translations.english_rwwad: and by the ships that sail with ease,

arabic_text: فَٱلۡمُقَسِّمَٰتِ أَمۡرًا
phonetic: 51.4 Fālmuqassimāti 'Amrāan

translations.english_saheeh: And the [angels] apportioning [each] matter,
translations.english_hilali_khan: And those (angels) who distribute (provisions, rain, and other blessings) by (Allâh’s) Command.
translations.english_rwwad: and by the angels who distribute [blessings] by His command.

arabic_text: إِنَّمَا تُوعَدُونَ لَصَادِقٞ
phonetic: 51.5 'Innamā Tū`adūna Laşādiqun

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, what you are promised is true.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, that which you are promised (i.e. Resurrection in the Hereafter and receiving the reward or punishment of good or bad deeds) is surely true.
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, what you are promised is true,

arabic_text: وَإِنَّ ٱلدِّينَ لَوَٰقِعٞ
phonetic: 51.6 Wa 'Inna Ad-Dīna Lawāqi`un

translations.english_saheeh: And indeed, the recompense is to occur.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And verily, the Recompense is sure to happen.
translations.english_rwwad: and the Judgment will surely come to pass.

arabic_text: وَٱلسَّمَآءِ ذَاتِ ٱلۡحُبُكِ
phonetic: 51.7 Wa As-Samā'i Dhāti Al-Ĥubuki

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1535]- Explained as tracks, layers or orbits.

translations.english_saheeh: By the heaven containing pathways,[1535]
translations.english_hilali_khan: By the heaven full of paths,
translations.english_rwwad: By the heaven with its pathways,

arabic_text: إِنَّكُمۡ لَفِي قَوۡلٖ مُّخۡتَلِفٖ
phonetic: 51.8 'Innakum Lafī Qawlin Mukhtalifin

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1536]- About Prophet Muḥammad (ﷺ) and the Qur’ān.

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, you are in differing speech.[1536]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Certainly, you have different ideas (about Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم and the Qur’ân).
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, you [Makkans] have conflicting views [about the truth].

arabic_text: يُؤۡفَكُ عَنۡهُ مَنۡ أُفِكَ
phonetic: 51.9 Yu'ufaku `Anhu Man 'Ufika

translations.english_saheeh: Deluded away from it [i.e., the Qur’ān] is he who is deluded.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Turned aside therefrom (i.e. from Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم and the Qur’ân) is he who is turned aside (by the Decree and Preordainment القضاء والقدر of Allâh).
translations.english_rwwad: He who is diverted from it is destined to be diverted.

arabic_text: قُتِلَ ٱلۡخَرَّٰصُونَ
phonetic: 51.10 Qutila Al-Kharrāşūna

translations.english_saheeh: Destroyed are the misinformers[1537]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Cursed be the liars
translations.english_rwwad: Doomed are those who base their beliefs on conjecture.

arabic_text: ٱلَّذِينَ هُمۡ فِي غَمۡرَةٖ سَاهُونَ
phonetic: 51.11 Al-Ladhīna Hum Fī Ghamratin Sāhūna

translations.english_saheeh: Who are within a flood [of confusion] and heedless.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Who are under a cover of heedlessness (think not about the gravity of the Hereafter),
translations.english_rwwad: those who are steeped in ignorance heedlessly.

arabic_text: يَسۡـَٔلُونَ أَيَّانَ يَوۡمُ ٱلدِّينِ
phonetic: 51.12 Yas'alūna 'Ayyāna Yawmu Ad-Dīni

translations.english_saheeh: They ask, "When is the Day of Recompense?"
translations.english_hilali_khan: They ask: "When will be the Day of Recompense?"
translations.english_rwwad: They ask [mockingly], “When is the Day of Judgment?”

arabic_text: يَوۡمَ هُمۡ عَلَى ٱلنَّارِ يُفۡتَنُونَ
phonetic: 51.13 Yawma Hum `Alá An-Nāri Yuftanūna

translations.english_saheeh: [It is] the Day they will be tormented over the Fire.
translations.english_hilali_khan: (It will be) a Day when they will be tried (punished i.e. burnt) over the Fire!
translations.english_rwwad: It is the Day when they will be punished by the Fire.

arabic_text: ذُوقُواْ فِتۡنَتَكُمۡ هَٰذَا ٱلَّذِي كُنتُم بِهِۦ تَسۡتَعۡجِلُونَ
phonetic: 51.14 Dhūqū Fitnatakum Hādhā Al-Ladhī Kuntum Bihi Tasta`jilūna

translations.english_saheeh: [And will be told], "Taste your torment. This is that for which you were impatient."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Taste you your trial (punishment i.e. burning)! This is what you used to ask to be hastened!"
translations.english_rwwad: [It will be said], “Taste your punishment! This is what you were seeking to hasten.”

arabic_text: إِنَّ ٱلۡمُتَّقِينَ فِي جَنَّٰتٖ وَعُيُونٍ
phonetic: 51.15 'Inna Al-Muttaqīna Fī Jannātin Wa `Uyūnin

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, the righteous will be among gardens and springs,
translations.english_hilali_khan: will be in the midst of Gardens and Springs (in the Paradise),
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, the righteous will be in gardens and springs,

arabic_text: ءَاخِذِينَ مَآ ءَاتَىٰهُمۡ رَبُّهُمۡۚ إِنَّهُمۡ كَانُواْ قَبۡلَ ذَٰلِكَ مُحۡسِنِينَ
phonetic: 51.16 'Ākhidhīna Mā 'Ātāhum Rabbuhum 'Innahum Kānū Qabla Dhālika Muĥsinīna

translations.english_saheeh: Accepting what their Lord has given them. Indeed, they were before that doers of good.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Taking joy in the things which their Lord has given them. Verily, they were before this Muhsinûn (good-doers. See V.2:112).
translations.english_rwwad: receiving what their Lord will give them, for they were indeed doers of good beforehand.

arabic_text: كَانُواْ قَلِيلٗا مِّنَ ٱلَّيۡلِ مَا يَهۡجَعُونَ
phonetic: 51.17 Kānū Qalīlāan Mina Al-Layli Mā Yahja`ūna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1538]- i.e., spending a portion of the night in prayer and supplication.

translations.english_saheeh: They used to sleep but little of the night,[1538]
translations.english_hilali_khan: They used to sleep but little by night [invoking their Lord (Allâh) and praying, with fear and hope].
translations.english_rwwad: They used to sleep but little at night,

arabic_text: وَبِٱلۡأَسۡحَارِ هُمۡ يَسۡتَغۡفِرُونَ
phonetic: 51.18 Wa Bil-'Asĥāri Hum Yastaghfirūna

translations.english_saheeh: And in the hours before dawn they would ask forgiveness,
translations.english_hilali_khan: And in the hours before dawn, they were (found) asking (Allâh) for forgiveness.
translations.english_rwwad: and before dawn they would seek forgiveness,

arabic_text: وَفِيٓ أَمۡوَٰلِهِمۡ حَقّٞ لِّلسَّآئِلِ وَٱلۡمَحۡرُومِ
phonetic: 51.19 Wa Fī 'Amwālihim Ĥaqqun Lilssā'ili Wa Al-Maĥrūmi

translations.english_saheeh: And from their properties was [given] the right of the [needy] petitioner and the deprived.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And in their properties there was the right of the Sâ’il (the beggar who asks) and the Mahrûm (the poor who does not ask others)[1].
translations.english_rwwad: and in their wealth, there was a share for the beggar and the destitute.

arabic_text: وَفِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ ءَايَٰتٞ لِّلۡمُوقِنِينَ
phonetic: 51.20 Wa Fī Al-'Arđi 'Āyātun Lilmūqinīna

translations.english_saheeh: And on the earth are signs for the certain [in faith]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And on the earth are signs for those who have Faith with certainty.
translations.english_rwwad: On earth there are signs for those who are certain in faith,

arabic_text: وَفِيٓ أَنفُسِكُمۡۚ أَفَلَا تُبۡصِرُونَ
phonetic: 51.21 Wa Fī 'Anfusikum 'Afalā Tubşirūna

translations.english_saheeh: And in yourselves. Then will you not see?
translations.english_hilali_khan: And also in your ownselves. Will you not then see?
translations.english_rwwad: and also in your own selves. Do you not see?

arabic_text: وَفِي ٱلسَّمَآءِ رِزۡقُكُمۡ وَمَا تُوعَدُونَ
phonetic: 51.22 Wa Fī As-Samā'i Rizqukum Wa Mā Tū`adūna

translations.english_saheeh: And in the heaven is your provision and whatever you are promised.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And in the heaven is your provision, and that which you are promised.
translations.english_rwwad: And in the heaven is your provision and all that you are promised.

arabic_text: فَوَرَبِّ ٱلسَّمَآءِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ إِنَّهُۥ لَحَقّٞ مِّثۡلَ مَآ أَنَّكُمۡ تَنطِقُونَ
phonetic: 51.23 Fawarabbi As-Samā'i Wa Al-'Arđi 'Innahu Laĥaqqun Mithla Mā 'Annakum Tanţiqūna

translations.english_saheeh: Then by the Lord of the heaven and earth, indeed, it is truth - just as [sure as] it is that you are speaking.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then by the Lord of the heaven and the earth, it is the truth (i.e. what has been promised to you), just as it is the truth that you can speak.
translations.english_rwwad: By the Lord of the heaven and earth, this [resurrection] is certainly as true as the fact that you can speak.

arabic_text: هَلۡ أَتَىٰكَ حَدِيثُ ضَيۡفِ إِبۡرَٰهِيمَ ٱلۡمُكۡرَمِينَ
phonetic: 51.24 Hal 'Atāka Ĥadīthu Đayfi 'Ibrāhīma Al-Mukramīna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1539]- Who were angels given honored positions by Allāh.

translations.english_saheeh: Has there reached you the story of the honored guests of Abraham?[1539] -
translations.english_hilali_khan: Has the story reached you, of the honoured guests [three angels; Jibrîl (Gabriel) along with another two] of Ibrâhîm (Abraham)?
translations.english_rwwad: Has there come to you the story of Abraham’s honored guests?

arabic_text: إِذۡ دَخَلُواْ عَلَيۡهِ فَقَالُواْ سَلَٰمٗاۖ قَالَ سَلَٰمٞ قَوۡمٞ مُّنكَرُونَ
phonetic: 51.25 'Idh Dakhalū `Alayhi Faqālū Salāmāan Qāla Salāmun Qawmun Munkarūna

translations.english_saheeh: When they entered upon him and said, "[We greet you with] peace." He answered, "[And upon you] peace; [you are] a people unknown."
translations.english_hilali_khan: When they came in to him and said: "Salâm, (peace be upon you)!" He answered: "Salâm, (peace be upon you)," and said: "You are a people unknown to me."
translations.english_rwwad: When they came to him and said, “Peace.” He said, “Upon you be peace.” [saying to himself] “Unknown people!”

arabic_text: فَرَاغَ إِلَىٰٓ أَهۡلِهِۦ فَجَآءَ بِعِجۡلٖ سَمِينٖ
phonetic: 51.26 Farāgha 'Ilá 'Ahlihi Fajā'a Bi`ijlin Samīnin

translations.english_saheeh: Then he went to his family and came with a fat [roasted] calf.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then he turned to his household, and brought out a roasted calf [as the property of Ibrâhîm (Abraham) was mainly cows].
translations.english_rwwad: Then he went quickly to his household, and came with a fat [roasted] calf,

arabic_text: فَقَرَّبَهُۥٓ إِلَيۡهِمۡ قَالَ أَلَا تَأۡكُلُونَ
phonetic: 51.27 Faqarrabahu 'Ilayhim Qāla 'Alā Ta'kulūna

translations.english_saheeh: And placed it near them; he said, "Will you not eat?"
translations.english_hilali_khan: And placed it before them, (saying): "Will you not eat?"
translations.english_rwwad: and placed it before them and said, “Will you not eat?”

arabic_text: فَأَوۡجَسَ مِنۡهُمۡ خِيفَةٗۖ قَالُواْ لَا تَخَفۡۖ وَبَشَّرُوهُ بِغُلَٰمٍ عَلِيمٖ
phonetic: 51.28 Fa'awjasa Minhum Khīfatan Qālū Lā Takhaf Wa Basharūhu Bighulāmin `Alīmin

footnotes.english_hilali_khan: (V.51:28) i.e. when the angels noticed some fear over the face of Abraham, they told him that they are Allâh’s messengers. And they also gave the glad news to his wife Sarah that she will give birth to a son (Isaac).

translations.english_saheeh: And he felt from them apprehension.[1540] They said, "Fear not," and gave him good tidings of a learned boy.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then he conceived fear of them (when they ate not). They said: "Fear not."[2] And they gave him glad tidings of a son having knowledge (about Allâh and His religion of True Monotheism).
translations.english_rwwad: He perceived a fear of them. They said, “Do not be afraid,” and gave him glad tidings of a knowledgeable son.

arabic_text: فَأَقۡبَلَتِ ٱمۡرَأَتُهُۥ فِي صَرَّةٖ فَصَكَّتۡ وَجۡهَهَا وَقَالَتۡ عَجُوزٌ عَقِيمٞ
phonetic: 51.29 Fa'aqbalati Amra'atuhu Fī Şarratin Faşakkat Wajhahā Wa Qālat `Ajūzun `Aqīmun

footnotes.english_hilali_khan: (V.51:29) "How can I bear a child." At that time she (Sarah) was approximately 99 years old. (Tafsîr Al-Qurtubi ).

translations.english_saheeh: And his wife approached with a cry [of alarm] and struck her face and said, "[I am] a barren old woman!"
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then his wife came forward with a loud voice: she smote her face, and said: "A barren old woman!"[3]
translations.english_rwwad: His wife cried out loud, and struck her face [in astonishment] and said, “[I am] a barren old woman!”

arabic_text: قَالُواْ كَذَٰلِكِ قَالَ رَبُّكِۖ إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ ٱلۡحَكِيمُ ٱلۡعَلِيمُ
phonetic: 51.30 Qālū Kadhāliki Qāla Rabbuki 'Innahu Huwa Al-Ĥakīmu Al-`Alīmu

footnotes.english_hilali_khan:
(V.51:30)
a) The Statement of Allâh عز وجل:
‘Verily, Our Word (Command) unto a thing, when We intend it, is only that We say unto it:
"Be!" - and it is.’ (V.16:40)
Narrated Mu‘âwiyah رضي الله عنه: I heard the Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم saying, "A group of my followers will keep on following Allâh’s Orders [i.e., following strictly Allâh’s Book (the Qur’ân) and the Prophet’s Sunnah (legal ways)] strictly and they will not be harmed by those who will belie (disbelieve) them or desert (stand against) them till Allâh’s Order (the Hour) will come while they will be in that state." (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol.9, Hadith No.552).
b) Narrated Abu Hurairah رضي الله عنه: Allâh’s Messenger صلى الله عليه وسلم said, "Allâh said, ‘I have prepared for My pious slaves things which have never been seen by an eye, nor heard by an ear, or (even) imagined by a human being.’" (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol. 4, Hadith No. 467)
c) Narrated Abû Sa‘îd Al-Khudrî رضي الله عنه: The Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم said, "The people of Paradise will look at the dwellers of Al-Ghuraf (the lofty mansions i.e. a superior place in Paradise) in the same way as one looks at a brilliant star far away in the east or in the west on the horizon; all that is because of their superiority over one another (in rewards)." On that the people said, "O Allâh’s Messenger! Are these residences (lofty mansions) for the Prophets which nobody else can reach?" The Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم replied, "No! By Him (Allah) in Whose Hand my soul is, these are for the men who believed in Allah and also believed in the Messengers." (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol. 4, Hadith No. 478)
d) Narrated Abu Hurairah رضي الله عنه: Allâh’s Messenger صلى الله عليه وسلم said, "The first batch (of people) who will enter Paradise will be (glittering) like the moon on a full-moon night and those who will enter next will be glittering like the brightest star. Their hearts will be as if the heart of a single man for they will have neither difference nor any enmity amongst themselves, and everyone of them shall have two wives, each of whom will be so beautiful, pure and transparent that the marrow of the bones of their legs will be seen through the flesh. They will be glorifying Allâh in the morning and afternoon, and will never fall ill, and they will neither blow their noses nor spit. Their utensils will be of gold and silver, and their combs will be of gold and the fuel used in their censers will be of aloes-wood and their sweat will smell like musk." ... (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol. 4, Hadith No. 469).

translations.english_saheeh: They said, "Thus has said your Lord; indeed, He is the Wise, the Knowing."
translations.english_hilali_khan: They said: "Even so says your Lord.[4] Verily, He is the All-Wise, the All-Knower."
translations.english_rwwad: They said, “This is what your Lord said. Indeed, He is the All-Wise, the All-Knowing.”

arabic_text: ۞ قَالَ فَمَا خَطۡبُكُمۡ أَيُّهَا ٱلۡمُرۡسَلُونَ
phonetic: 51.31 Qāla Famā Khaţbukum 'Ayyuhā Al-Mursalūna

translations.english_saheeh: [Abraham] said, "Then what is your business [here], O messengers?"
translations.english_hilali_khan: [Ibrâhîm (Abraham)] said: "Then for what purpose you have come, O Messengers?"
translations.english_rwwad: Abraham said, “Then what is your mission, O messengers?”

arabic_text: قَالُوٓاْ إِنَّآ أُرۡسِلۡنَآ إِلَىٰ قَوۡمٖ مُّجۡرِمِينَ
phonetic: 51.32 Qālū 'Innā 'Ursilnā 'Ilá Qawmin Mujrimīna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1541]- i.e., those who defied Lot (upon him be peace).

translations.english_saheeh: They said, "Indeed, we have been sent to a people of criminals[1541]
translations.english_hilali_khan: They said: "We have been sent to a people who are Mujrimûn (polytheists, sinners, criminals, disbelievers in Allâh)
translations.english_rwwad: They said, “We have been sent to a wicked people,

arabic_text: لِنُرۡسِلَ عَلَيۡهِمۡ حِجَارَةٗ مِّن طِينٖ
phonetic: 51.33 Linursila `Alayhim Ĥijāratan Min Ţīnin

translations.english_saheeh: To send down upon them stones of clay,
translations.english_hilali_khan: To send down upon them stones of baked clay.
translations.english_rwwad: to send down upon them stones of clay,

arabic_text: مُّسَوَّمَةً عِندَ رَبِّكَ لِلۡمُسۡرِفِينَ
phonetic: 51.34 Musawwamatan `Inda Rabbika Lilmusrifīna

translations.english_saheeh: Marked in the presence of your Lord for the transgressors."
translations.english_hilali_khan: Marked by your Lord for the Musrifûn (polytheists, criminals, sinners - those who trespass Allâh’s set limits in evil-doings by committing great sins).
translations.english_rwwad: marked by your Lord for the transgressors.”

arabic_text: فَأَخۡرَجۡنَا مَن كَانَ فِيهَا مِنَ ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ
phonetic: 51.35 Fa'akhrajnā Man Kāna Fīhā Mina Al-Mu'uminīna

translations.english_saheeh: So We brought out whoever was in them [i.e., the cities] of the believers.
translations.english_hilali_khan: So We brought out from therein the believers.
translations.english_rwwad: We brought out those believers who were there,

arabic_text: فَمَا وَجَدۡنَا فِيهَا غَيۡرَ بَيۡتٖ مِّنَ ٱلۡمُسۡلِمِينَ
phonetic: 51.36 Famā Wajadnā Fīhā Ghayra Baytin Mina Al-Muslimīna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1542]- i.e., Lot and his family, excepting his wife.

translations.english_saheeh: And We found not within them other than a [single] house of Muslims.[1542]
translations.english_hilali_khan: But We found not there any household of the Muslims except one [of Lût (Lot) and his two daughters].
translations.english_rwwad: but We only found in it one Muslim household [Lot's family].

arabic_text: وَتَرَكۡنَا فِيهَآ ءَايَةٗ لِّلَّذِينَ يَخَافُونَ ٱلۡعَذَابَ ٱلۡأَلِيمَ
phonetic: 51.37 Wa Taraknā Fīhā 'Āyatan Lilladhīna Yakhāfūna Al-`Adhāba Al-'Alīma

footnotes.english_hilali_khan: (V.51:37) See the book of history "The Stories of the Prophets." by Ibn Kathir رحمه الله.

translations.english_saheeh: And We left therein a sign for those who fear the painful punishment.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And We have left there a sign (i.e. the place of the Dead Sea[1] in Palestine) for those who fear the painful torment.
translations.english_rwwad: And We left there a sign [as a lesson] for those who fear the painful punishment.

arabic_text: وَفِي مُوسَىٰٓ إِذۡ أَرۡسَلۡنَٰهُ إِلَىٰ فِرۡعَوۡنَ بِسُلۡطَٰنٖ مُّبِينٖ
phonetic: 51.38 Wa Fī Mūsá 'Idh 'Arsalnāhu 'Ilá Fir`awna Bisulţānin Mubīnin

translations.english_saheeh: And in Moses [was a sign], when We sent him to Pharaoh with clear authority.[1543]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And in Mûsâ (Moses) (too, there is a sign), when We sent him to Fir‘aun (Pharaoh) with a manifest authority.
translations.english_rwwad: And [there is a sign in the story of] Moses when We sent him to Pharaoh with compelling proofs,

arabic_text: فَتَوَلَّىٰ بِرُكۡنِهِۦ وَقَالَ سَٰحِرٌ أَوۡ مَجۡنُونٞ
phonetic: 51.39 Fatawallá Biruknihi Wa Qāla Sāĥirun 'Aw Majnūnun

translations.english_saheeh: But he turned away with his supporters and said, "A magician or a madman."
translations.english_hilali_khan: But [Fir‘aun (Pharaoh)] turned away (from Belief in might) along with his hosts, and said: "A sorcerer, or a madman."
translations.english_rwwad: But he and his supporters turned away, and he said about [Moses], “A magician or a madman!”

arabic_text: فَأَخَذۡنَٰهُ وَجُنُودَهُۥ فَنَبَذۡنَٰهُمۡ فِي ٱلۡيَمِّ وَهُوَ مُلِيمٞ
phonetic: 51.40 Fa'akhadhnāhu Wa Junūdahu Fanabadhnāhum Fī Al-Yammi Wa Huwa Mulīmun

translations.english_saheeh: So We took him and his soldiers and cast them into the sea, and he was blameworthy.
translations.english_hilali_khan: So We took him and his hosts, and dumped them into the sea, for he was blameworthy.
translations.english_rwwad: So We seized him and his soldiers, and cast them into the sea while he was blameworthy.

arabic_text: وَفِي عَادٍ إِذۡ أَرۡسَلۡنَا عَلَيۡهِمُ ٱلرِّيحَ ٱلۡعَقِيمَ
phonetic: 51.41 Wa Fī `Ādin 'Idh 'Arsalnā `Alayhimu Ar-Rīĥa Al-`Aqīma

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1544]- Barren of any benefit, i.e., evil.

translations.english_saheeh: And in ʿAad [was a sign], when We sent against them the barren wind.[1544]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And in ‘Âd (there is also a sign) when We sent against them the barren wind;
translations.english_rwwad: And [there is a sign in the story of] ‘Ād, when We sent against them the devastating barren wind.

arabic_text: مَا تَذَرُ مِن شَيۡءٍ أَتَتۡ عَلَيۡهِ إِلَّا جَعَلَتۡهُ كَٱلرَّمِيمِ
phonetic: 51.42 Mā Tadharu Min Shay'in 'Atat `Alayhi 'Illā Ja`alat/hu Kālrramīmi

translations.english_saheeh: It left nothing of what it came upon but that it made it like disintegrated ruins.
translations.english_hilali_khan: It spared nothing that it reached, but blew it into broken spreads of rotten ruins.
translations.english_rwwad: It spared nothing it came upon except that it reduced it to ruin and decay.

arabic_text: وَفِي ثَمُودَ إِذۡ قِيلَ لَهُمۡ تَمَتَّعُواْ حَتَّىٰ حِينٖ
phonetic: 51.43 Wa Fī Thamūda 'Idh Qīla Lahum Tamatta`ū Ĥattá Ĥīnin

translations.english_saheeh: And in Thamūd, when it was said to them, "Enjoy yourselves for a time."
translations.english_hilali_khan: And in Thamûd (there is also a sign), when they were told: "Enjoy yourselves for a while!"
translations.english_rwwad: And [there is a sign in the story of] Thamūd, when they were told, “Enjoy yourselves for a while.”

arabic_text: فَعَتَوۡاْ عَنۡ أَمۡرِ رَبِّهِمۡ فَأَخَذَتۡهُمُ ٱلصَّٰعِقَةُ وَهُمۡ يَنظُرُونَ
phonetic: 51.44 Fa`ataw `An 'Amri Rabbihim Fa'akhadhat/humu Aş-Şā`iqatu Wa Hum Yanžurūna

footnotes.english_hilali_khan: (V.51:44) Sâ‘iqah: A destructive awful cry, torment, hit, a thunderbolt, See (V.41:13).

translations.english_saheeh: But they were insolent toward the command of their Lord, so the thunderbolt seized them while they were looking on.
translations.english_hilali_khan: But they insolently defied the Command of their Lord, so the Sâ‘iqah[2] overtook them while they were looking.
translations.english_rwwad: But they rebelled against the command of their Lord, so the thunderbolt seized them, while they were looking on.

arabic_text: فَمَا ٱسۡتَطَٰعُواْ مِن قِيَامٖ وَمَا كَانُواْ مُنتَصِرِينَ
phonetic: 51.45 Famā Astaţā`ū Min Qiyāmin Wa Mā Kānū Muntaşirīna

translations.english_saheeh: And they were unable to arise, nor could they defend themselves.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then they were unable to rise up, nor could they help themselves.
translations.english_rwwad: They could not withstand it, nor could they ward it off.

arabic_text: وَقَوۡمَ نُوحٖ مِّن قَبۡلُۖ إِنَّهُمۡ كَانُواْ قَوۡمٗا فَٰسِقِينَ
phonetic: 51.46 Wa Qawma Nūĥin Min Qablu 'Innahum Kānū Qawmāan Fāsiqīna

translations.english_saheeh: And [We destroyed] the people of Noah before; indeed, they were a people defiantly disobedient.
translations.english_hilali_khan: (So were) the people of Nûh (Noah) before them. Verily, they were a people who were Fâsiqûn (rebellious, disobedient to Allâh).
translations.english_rwwad: And the people of Noah [were also destroyed] before them. They were indeed a rebellious people.

arabic_text: وَٱلسَّمَآءَ بَنَيۡنَٰهَا بِأَيۡيْدٖ وَإِنَّا لَمُوسِعُونَ
phonetic: 51.47 Wa As-Samā'a Banaynāhā Bi'ayydin Wa 'Innā Lamūsi`ūna

translations.english_saheeh: And the heaven We constructed with strength,[1545] and indeed, We are [its] expander.
translations.english_hilali_khan: With power did We construct the heaven. Verily, We are Able to extend the vastness of space thereof.
translations.english_rwwad: We built the heaven with might, and We are indeed expanding it.

arabic_text: وَٱلۡأَرۡضَ فَرَشۡنَٰهَا فَنِعۡمَ ٱلۡمَٰهِدُونَ
phonetic: 51.48 Wa Al-'Arđa Farashnāhā Fani`ma Al-Māhidūna

translations.english_saheeh: And the earth We have spread out, and excellent is the preparer.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And We have spread out the earth: how Excellent Spreader (thereof) are We!
translations.english_rwwad: And We spread out the earth. How well did We smooth it out!

arabic_text: وَمِن كُلِّ شَيۡءٍ خَلَقۡنَا زَوۡجَيۡنِ لَعَلَّكُمۡ تَذَكَّرُونَ
phonetic: 51.49 Wa Min Kulli Shay'in Khalaqnā Zawjayni La`allakum Tadhakkarūna

translations.english_saheeh: And of all things We created two mates [i.e., counterparts]; perhaps you will remember.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And of everything We have created pairs, that you may remember (the Grace of Allâh).
translations.english_rwwad: And We have created everything in pairs, so that you may take heed.

arabic_text: فَفِرُّوٓاْ إِلَى ٱللَّهِۖ إِنِّي لَكُم مِّنۡهُ نَذِيرٞ مُّبِينٞ
phonetic: 51.50 Fafirrū 'Ilá Allāhi 'Innī Lakum Minhu Nadhīrun Mubīnun

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1546]- i.e., turn to Allāh and take refuge in Him from disbelief and sin, thereby escaping His punishment.

translations.english_saheeh: So flee to Allāh.[1546] Indeed, I am to you from Him a clear warner.
translations.english_hilali_khan: So flee to Allâh (from His Torment to His Mercy - Islâmic Monotheism). Verily, I (Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) am a plain warner to you from Him.[3]
translations.english_rwwad: So flee to Allah. Indeed, I am a clear warner to you from Him.

arabic_text: وَلَا تَجۡعَلُواْ مَعَ ٱللَّهِ إِلَٰهًا ءَاخَرَۖ إِنِّي لَكُم مِّنۡهُ نَذِيرٞ مُّبِينٞ
phonetic: 51.51 Wa Lā Taj`alū Ma`a Allāhi 'Ilahāan 'Ākhara 'Innī Lakum Minhu Nadhīrun Mubīnun

translations.english_saheeh: And do not make [as equal] with Allāh another deity. Indeed, I am to you from Him a clear warner.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And set not up (or worship not) any other ilâh (god) along with Allâh [Glorified be He (Alone), Exalted above all that they associate as partners with Him]. Verily, I (Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) am a plain warner to you from Him.
translations.english_rwwad: And do not set up another god with Allah. Indeed, I am a clear warner to you from Him.”

arabic_text: كَذَٰلِكَ مَآ أَتَى ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبۡلِهِم مِّن رَّسُولٍ إِلَّا قَالُواْ سَاحِرٌ أَوۡ مَجۡنُونٌ
phonetic: 51.52 Kadhālika Mā 'Atá Al-Ladhīna Min Qablihim Min Rasūlin 'Illā Qālū Sāĥirun 'Aw Majnūnun

translations.english_saheeh: Similarly, there came not to those before them any messenger except that they said, "A magician or a madman."
translations.english_hilali_khan: Likewise, no Messenger came to those before them but they said: "A sorcerer or a madman!"
translations.english_rwwad: Likewise, no messenger came to those before them without being told: “A magician, or a madman!”

arabic_text: أَتَوَاصَوۡاْ بِهِۦۚ بَلۡ هُمۡ قَوۡمٞ طَاغُونَ
phonetic: 51.53 'Atawāşaw Bihi Bal Hum Qawmun Ţāghūna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1547]- i.e., Did the former disbelievers pass on these words to the Makkans so that they repeat the same expressions?

translations.english_saheeh: Did they suggest it to them?[1547] Rather, they [themselves] are a transgressing people.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Have they (the people of the past) transmitted this saying to these (Quraish pagans)? Nay, they are themselves a people transgressing beyond bounds (in disbelief)!
translations.english_rwwad: Did they suggest this to one another? Rather they are a transgressing people.

arabic_text: فَتَوَلَّ عَنۡهُمۡ فَمَآ أَنتَ بِمَلُومٖ
phonetic: 51.54 Fatawalla `Anhum Famā 'Anta Bimalūmin

translations.english_saheeh: So leave them, [O Muḥammad], for you are not to be blamed.
translations.english_hilali_khan: So turn away (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) from them (Quraish pagans), you are not blame-worthy (as you have conveyed Allâh’s Message).
translations.english_rwwad: So turn away from them [O Prophet], for you are not to blame.

arabic_text: وَذَكِّرۡ فَإِنَّ ٱلذِّكۡرَىٰ تَنفَعُ ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ
phonetic: 51.55 Wa Dhakkir Fa'inna Adh-Dhikrá Tanfa`u Al-Mu'uminīna

translations.english_saheeh: And remind, for indeed, the reminder benefits the believers.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And remind (by preaching the Qur’ân, O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم), for verily, the reminding profits the believers.
translations.english_rwwad: But keep reminding them, for reminder benefits the believers.

arabic_text: وَمَا خَلَقۡتُ ٱلۡجِنَّ وَٱلۡإِنسَ إِلَّا لِيَعۡبُدُونِ
phonetic: 51.56 Wa Mā Khalaqtu Al-Jinna Wa Al-'Insa 'Illā Liya`budūni

translations.english_saheeh: And I did not create the jinn and mankind except to worship Me.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And I (Allâh) created not the jinn and mankind except that they should worship Me (Alone).
translations.english_rwwad: I have not created the jinn and mankind except to worship Me.

arabic_text: مَآ أُرِيدُ مِنۡهُم مِّن رِّزۡقٖ وَمَآ أُرِيدُ أَن يُطۡعِمُونِ
phonetic: 51.57 Mā 'Urīdu Minhum Min Rizqin Wa Mā 'Urīdu 'An Yuţ`imūni

translations.english_saheeh: I do not want from them any provision, nor do I want them to feed Me.
translations.english_hilali_khan: I seek not any provision from them (i.e. provision for themselves or for My creatures) nor do I ask that they should feed Me (i.e. feed themselves or My creatures).
translations.english_rwwad: I seek no provision from them, nor do I want them to feed Me.

arabic_text: إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ هُوَ ٱلرَّزَّاقُ ذُو ٱلۡقُوَّةِ ٱلۡمَتِينُ
phonetic: 51.58 'Inna Allāha Huwa Ar-Razzāqu Dhū Al-Qūwati Al-Matīnu

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1548]- Providing everything required by His creations during their decreed existence.  His provision includes guidance.

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, it is Allāh who is the [continual] Provider,[1548] the firm possessor of strength.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, Allâh is the All-Provider, Owner of Power, the Most Strong.
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, it is Allah Who is the All-Provider, Lord of Power, the Mighty.

arabic_text: فَإِنَّ لِلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُواْ ذَنُوبٗا مِّثۡلَ ذَنُوبِ أَصۡحَٰبِهِمۡ فَلَا يَسۡتَعۡجِلُونِ
phonetic: 51.59 Fa'inna Lilladhīna Žalamū Dhanūbāan Mithla Dhanūbi 'Aşĥābihim Falā Yasta`jilūni

translations.english_saheeh: And indeed, for those who have wronged is a portion [of punishment] like the portion of their companions [i.e., predecessors], so let them not impatiently urge Me.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And verily, for those who do wrong, there is a portion of torment like to the evil portion of torment (which came for) their likes (of old); so let them not ask Me to hasten on!
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, those who do wrong will have a share [of [punishment] like that of their predecessors, so let them not ask Me to hasten it.

arabic_text: فَوَيۡلٞ لِّلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ مِن يَوۡمِهِمُ ٱلَّذِي يُوعَدُونَ
phonetic: 51.60 Fawaylun Lilladhīna Kafarū Min Yawmihimu Al-Ladhī Yū`adūna

footnotes.english_hilali_khan:
(V.51:60)
A) See the footnote of (V.3:85).
B) Narrated Anas رضي الله عنه: The Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم said, "Allâh will say to the person of the (Hell) Fire who will receive the least punishment, ‘If you had everything on the earth, would you give it as a ransom to free yourself (i.e., save yourself from this Fire)?" He will say, ‘Yes.’ Then Allâh will say, ‘While you were in the backbone of Adam, I asked you much less than this, (i.e., not to worship others besides Me), but you insisted on worshipping others besides me.’" (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol. 4, Hadith No.551).

translations.english_saheeh: And woe to those who have disbelieved from their Day which they are promised.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then woe to those who disbelieve (in Allâh and His Oneness - Islâmic Monotheism) from their Day which they have been promised (for their punishment).[1]
translations.english_rwwad: So woe to those who disbelieve from [the punishment of] the Day which they are promised.
